Very Brief Testimony
content.p: I grew up going to church and believing all the right things. While on summer vacation between eighth and ninth grade, I spent a lot of time reading the Bible and came to understand the difference between being religious and having a relationship with God. I made a commitment to Christ and knew in my heart that God's plan for my life was to plant and pastor a Calvary Chapel someday.
content.heading: Favorite Book of the Bible and Why
content.p: Ephesians was an early favorite. It captures the essence of the Christian life.
content.heading: Favorite Verse and Why
Favorite Book (besides the Bible) and Why
content.p: I have read "Walking with the Giants" by Warren Wiersbe over and over again. It inspires me to give God my best.
content.heading: Who do you most admire (besides Jesus)
content.p: My wife, Andrea, for the way she handles the impossible role of "pastor's wife".
content.heading: What do you do at Calvary
content.p: My God-given role is two-fold: teacher and vision-caster (i.e. I communicate and lead).
